description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bo039","text":"Overview and Goals","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c950","text":"Your bacterial isolate has been grown on agar plates. You practiced pipetting. Now, let’s learn about how your organism grows! What nutrients help your bacterium grow? We will use plates with ninety-six wells with different conditions to examine the growth and metabolic capacity of your isolate. For this, we will use special Biolog plates and your Blood Universal Growth (BUG) media containing plates with your organism. Biolog plates allow researchers to test and visually (colorimetrically!) analyze the growth of bacteria in numerous conditions… up to 30 conditions in one plate! Biolog plates work by having powder chemicals in the wells along with an inoculating fluid and a dye that changes color when an organism is growing (“metabolic dye”). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":423,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":423,"length":6}],"data":{}},{"key":"auh1b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eeoga","text":"After completing this lab you will gain the following lab skills:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aff06","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ar3v1","text":"Lab safety and proper personal protective equipment (PPE)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpd6n","text":"Proper use of Biolog plates and multichannel pipettors","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa9mj","text":"Proper use of a turbidimeter to adjust bacterial densities","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9motj","text":"Analysis of growth data of bacteria in 96-well plates","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5274A0544A6311ED94B60A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://biolog.com"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3eih8","text":"Set your p200 multichannel pipet to   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"35j9i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"D4DAAF804A6411ED8B2227E5C6B7FE55","id":"93130","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4at6c","text":"Load 8 tips onto each gasket of the multichannel pipet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ce4vh","text":"Press the plunger to the first stop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6lbc8","text":"Submerge all 8 tips into the water with food coloring.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5dtss","text":"With thumb control, release the plunger to take up liquid. Check each tip to make sure each has the same volume of liquid. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b71m4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4585e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5e56q","text":" Note the height of the liquid in the tips. Is it consistent?","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3gr97","text":"Align each tip with one well across one column of the 96-well plate (refer to image or the descriptions below)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"abc4d","text":"Yellow water should go in odd numbered columns 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dfmpc","text":"Green water should go in the even numbered columns 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93ii3","text":"If using colors other than yellow and green, make your own pattern.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d0qq1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2it1","text":"Reference image:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"xnryp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A32AE7374A6511ED94B60A58A9FEAC02","height":"430","id":"A3C1C1D04A6511ED8B2227E5C6B7FE55","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/FNb35f6VTsYu5dL964MdTW4vN6z8cJc6yelHqTHoVvQhOF7ij5fHNRM_18azkKfLz5SfpCt9YvaVpwEFma8CFzeYVW-4xXVPjk3yHSRXLtu3TbNONViW-s7zPHpHSEdtpOIzcltqSQ9cilr1806dnLtCzNuqeO3EPAJ-jCJUnVmltyhvgT0mpdy0uA","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/FNb35f6VTsYu5dL964MdTW4vN6z8cJc6yelHqTHoVvQhOF7ij5fHNRM_18azkKfLz5SfpCt9YvaVpwEFma8CFzeYVW-4xXVPjk3yHSRXLtu3TbNONViW-s7zPHpHSEdtpOIzcltqSQ9cilr1806dnLtCzNuqeO3EPAJ-jCJUnVmltyhvgT0mpdy0uA","width":"616"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51hpt","text":"Press the plunger THROUGH the first stop, raise your tips up out of the plate, and then you may release your plunger with thumb control.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ahkol","text":"Have each researcher do two to three columns of the plate to practice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4g2ji","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8sn22","text":"Calibrate the turbidimeter to a \"blank\" sample of inoculation fluid in a tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"72qju","text":"Using the Biolog Turbidimeter, blank the turbidimeter with a clean tube  containing uninoculated IF-A.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"be8ub","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"blvlj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5maar","text":"-Wipe the tube clean of dirt and fingerprints","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c3f8l","text":"-Because the tubes used are not optically uniform, they should be blanked individually. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31gbn","text":"Set the 100% transmittance adjustment knob so that the meter reads 100%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":67,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a7pep","text":"Record reading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5u138","text":"Use Turbidimeter with bacterial sample in the inoculation fluid in a tube ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ud7o","text":"Collect bacteria from your streak plate by touching the Inoculatorz™ swab to the bacteria","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8rm40","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ca4sk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5ogeg","text":"Be gentle: do not push the swab through the agar media","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7q8rg","text":"Open your Inoculating Fluid tube (IF) tube and submerge the swab into the liquid. Swirl the swab around in the fluid for   to ensure inoculation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":121,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"abbne","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"e8fpc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bhlcu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":15,"guid":"475D57104A9711ED8B214775B01C0BE5","id":"82546","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c29dp","text":"Do not leave the liquid uncapped longer than necessary to prevent contamination. The tubes are glass: work carefully.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2dp3","text":"Cap the tube and gently invert the three (3) times to ensure thorough mixing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6i5rt","text":"The target cell density is 95%T for our protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"afb8b","text":"Add more bacteria with the swab if necessary to get as close to this value as possible by continuing to add more bacteria with the swab to the tube.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"s6fp","text":"Work carefully and keep the tube capped. If necessary, use another swab if you think it has touched another surface.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ufte","text":"Once you've reached the target cell density at 95%T, cap the tube and proceed to the next Activity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":47,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b340e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d7js","text":"Pour the cell suspension into the multichannel pipette reservoir. {"blocks":[{"key":"2rrfh","text":"Load 8 tips onto each gasket of the multichannel pipet and fill the tips by drawing up    of cell suspension from the reservoir. {"blocks":[{"key":"1um0r","text":"Use the multichannel to add    of diluted bacterial culture to each of the 96 wells of the GEN III MicroPlateTM. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":91,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":91,"length":20}],"data":[]},{"key":"ajj4l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4e2ll","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2s0du","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"5m14m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cik13","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"20804EC04A6711ED8B2227E5C6B7FE55","id":"93132","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1CF28AC64A6711ED94B60A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.biolog.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/00P_185_GEN_III_MicroPlate_IFU.pdf"}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dqgj3","text":"Use the technique practiced in Activity 1.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"3":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"99h2k","text":"If the tips touch the wells, replace your tips before delivering inoculation fluid to the next column. Work carefully to avoid contamination! ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7va0r","text":"Eject the pipettor tips if any one tip touches the wells of the plate as this can cross contamination wells with chemicals. Reload tips as needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c64p9","text":"Check that all wells have liquid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fc0vr","text":"Cover the GEN3 microplate with its lid and eject the pipette tips. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
